text: Bob, I’ve heard you’ve been spreading lies about me at work.
Alice, I don’t know what you’re talking about—this is a misunderstanding.
Save it. If I catch you whispering a single word about me again, I’ll make sure you pay for it.
Please, there’s no need to escalate—let’s just talk this through.
Talking is over. Consider this your one and only warning.
Alright, I understand. You won’t hear a peep out of me.
